senses.sense_definition: A covered pouch, usually one of a pair, attached to a saddle on a horse or a motorcycle.

examples.text: He packed his supplies into the leather <w>saddlebags</w> before mounting his horse.
The rider stored his rain gear in the motorcycle <w>saddlebags</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A small bag attached to the seat or seat post of a bicycle.

examples.text: She keeps a repair kit and a spare tube in her bicycle <w>saddlebag</w>.
The cyclist reached into the <w>saddlebag</w> to grab an energy bar.

senses.sense_definition: Loose fatty flesh on a person's upper thighs or buttocks.

examples.text: She started a new exercise routine to help reduce her <w>saddlebags</w>.
The article suggested that running is effective for getting rid of <w>saddlebags</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A style of house featuring two rooms separated by a small central hall and open space.

examples.text: The pioneers built a sturdy <w>saddlebag</w> cabin in the clearing.
Historians visited the old <w>saddlebag</w> house to study its unique architecture.

senses.sense_definition: To put a saddlebag on an animal.

examples.text: The rancher <w>saddlebagged</w> the mule before loading the supplies.
Once the horses were <w>saddlebagged</w>, the group began their journey.
